marklogic.body:
Dr. Jack Cashill really homes in on the beam, like the investigative reporter I've long admired, building on the analysis of Dr. Jerome Corsi and superb gumshoe work by Sheriff Joe Arpaio's Cold case posse. Has Dr. Jack shaken the Irish disease, tossed the sauce and clambered aboard the wagon from which Iâ€™ve just fallen?
What would we do without our Ph.D.s? Maybe they will eventually realize that official investigation is needed, not only to confirm Obama's constitutional eligibility at birth, but also to find out that the key eligibility question is the effect, if any, of Obama's Indonesian naturalization on his U.S. citizenship. Nobody will find Obama ineligible at birth, but full disclosure of all relevant and material evidence of the effect of Barryâ€™s Indonesian naturalization on his American citizenship provides a reasonable basis for finding that Barry relinquished his U.S. citizenship by 1981. Loss of citizenship means loss of eligibility to the Office of President. Obama can't be a natural born U.S. citizen if he is no longer a U.S. citizen at all, even though he was a natural born U.S. citizen on the day of his birth.
It seems to be dimly on Dr. Jerry that Obama was adopted in Hawai'i. He says,Â "Obama refuses to waive privacy rights that would allow the Hawaii Department of Health to release any adoption records that may exist for him." SeeÂ http://www.wnd.com/2012/03/postman-ayers-family-put-foreigner-obama-through-school/Â (article linked in the Dr. Jack's piece herein).
Dr. Jack is still lagging Dr. Jerry a bit. I heard Dr. Jack mightily affirm to a group that Barry was born of Stanley Ann Dunham, notwithstanding my frantic silent signals waving him Off the point. Never mind she wasn't on the island when Barry was born there and the mitochondrial DNA of her daughter Maya Soetoro-Ng doesn't match Barry's.
Dr. Jerry rates a B-. Dr. Jack gets a gentleman's C for trying hard and improving so much since his book on disrespecting, or whatever, Obama - didn't "dis" him enough.
